detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: No direct student registration to RLE sections of CHEM445. A list of available RLE projects will be circulated via email in August and a matching process carried out in early September; you may alternately organize a placement directly with a faculty supervisor before then.

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes

instances.text: CHIN_V 403-021 - Advanced Chinese Reading and Writing II (Non-Heritage)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Placement Procedure -Prior to registration in any CHIN-titled courses, students are required to complete the Placement Procedure every Winter session or Summer Session and obtain a placement approval certificate for the courses they wish to register for. Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course.

Delivery Mode -This course has 3 instructional hrs/wk in person, 1.5 hours on Tuesday and 1.5 hrs on Thursday, both conducted synchronously. For further information regarding CHIN courses, please go to https://chinese.arts.ubc.ca/courses/ .

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

instances.text: CHIN_V 463-021 - Early Classical Chinese Poetry (Han to Tang)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Placement Procedure -Prior to registration in any CHIN-titled courses, students are required to complete the Placement Procedure every Winter session or Summer Session and obtain a placement approval certificate for the courses they wish to register for. Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course. 

Delivery Mode -This course is fully online with 3 instructional hrs per week, 1.5 hrs on Monday and 1.5 hrs on Wednesday, both conducted synchronously. Students are expected to meet online using Zoom on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘online’ are fully online for the entire term, including exams, and do NOT require any in-person attendance to complete.

Waitlist Policy - All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

instances.text: CHIN_V 473-023 - Later Classical Chinese Poetry (after Tang)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
Placement Procedure -Prior to registration in any CHIN-titled courses, students are required to complete the Placement Procedure every Winter session or Summer Session and obtain a placement approval certificate for the courses they wish to register for. Students are only eligible for courses listed on their placement approval certificate. Students enrolled in sections which they do not have placement approval for will be removed from the course.

Delivery Mode -  This course is fully online with 3 instructional hrs per week, among which 1 hr of lecture will be conducted online synchronously on Wednesday and 2hr of flexible asynchronous learning as outlined on the syllabus. Students are expected to meet online using Zoom on the days and times listed, as well as complete supplemental asynchronous work outside of class time. Please refer to the course syllabus for details on the asynchronous elements of this course. All courses labelled as ‘online’ are fully online for the entire term, including exams, and do NOT require any in-person attendance to complete.If you are interested in fully in person courses, please check out other sections CHIN473.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

instances.text: CINE_V 432-A_001 - Seminar in Motion Picture Forms (A)

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value: If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding wait list section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

detailResultFields.label: Course Section Definition Public Notes
detailResultFields.value:
A course that mixes murder and laughter; 'Murder by Death' and 'A Simple Favor' (and Buster Keaton) will feature.

If this section if FULL or BLOCKED please sign up for the corresponding wait list section. Once you have registered in the wait list there is no need to contact the department. Your registration will be switched to the parent section when space becomes available. Preference may be given to Majors, Minors, or Honours students in Theatre or Film. For more information about Department of Theatre and Film wait lists please visit: http://theatrefilm.ubc.ca/undergraduate/undergraduate-courses/how-to-wait-list-a-course/

uiLabels.WDRES.FACETEDSEARCH.SymanSyntax:
Boolean logic can be expressed using AND, OR, NOT, and (). 
Exact phrases can be surrounded by double quotation marks. 
Example: ("software engineer" OR computer science) AND ~manager~.
